Definition at line 47 of file CObject.h.

Member Function Documentation

bool CObject::checkforScenario (  ) 

This function will check if the enemy is in the limited scenario, so it will triggered. Happens normally when the Object is seen on the screen.

Definition at line 334 of file CObject.cpp.

bool CObject::hitdetectWithTileProperty ( Uint16  Property  ) 

this new type of hit detection only checks if the foe touches something that has that property

Parameters:
Property The Tile Property we are looking
Returns:
true if detection worked with that tile having the property, else false

Definition at line 806 of file CObject.cpp.

void CObject::blink ( Uint16  frametime  ) 

This function triggers the blinking behavior of an object. Normally this happens, when an enemy gets shot and can get multiple hits.

Parameters:
frametime amount of drawn blinking frames during the blitting. Every draw cycle performs one

Definition at line 1179 of file CObject.cpp.

void CObject::moveSlopedTileUp ( int  x,
int  y,
int  xspeed 
)

So far only used in Galaxy. This is the code for sloped tiles upside

0 Jump through 1 Flat bottom 2 Bottom-> Middle 3 Middle -> top 4 Bottom -> top 5 Middle -> bottom 6 Top -> middle 7 Top -> bottom
